DataElement.preferredName: Musculoskeletal Tumor Society Rating Scale Upper Extremity Hand Positioning Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of upper extremity hand positioning, using a six-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Musculoskeletal Tumor Society Rating Scale Upper Extremity Hand Positioning Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities._Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two._A question about the range of movement of a person's upper extremity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities.

Concepts.definition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.:A question about the range of movement of a person's upper extremity.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.
A question about the range of movement of a person's upper extremity.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: MSTS Extremity Hand Positioning Score 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (None) to 5 (Unlimited) on a Likert scale used on the Musculoskeletal Tumor Rating Scale questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person has no ability to lift their arm and hand.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person has no ability to lift their arm and hand.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person has a greatly reduced range of motion of their upper extremity, unable to lift their arm and hand above the waist, 30 degree elevation.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person has a greatly reduced range of motion of their upper extremity, unable to lift their arm and hand above the waist, 30 degree elevation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intermediate - Between not above shoulder and not above waist

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intermediate - Between not above shoulder and not above waist
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person has a limited range of motion of their upper extremity: only able to lift their hand to a level intermediate between their shoulder and their waist, with no pronation or supination of the hand.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person has a limited range of motion of their upper extremity: only able to lift their hand to a level intermediate between their shoulder and their waist, with no pronation or supination of the hand.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not above shoulder (90 degree elevation); no pronation or supination

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not above shoulder (90 degree elevation); no pronation or supination
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person has a reduced range of motion of their upper extremity, unable to lift their arm and hand above the shoulder, with no pronation or supination of the hand.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person has a reduced range of motion of their upper extremity, unable to lift their arm and hand above the shoulder, with no pronation or supination of the hand.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intermediate - Between unlimited and not above shoulder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intermediate - Between unlimited and not above shoulder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person has a reduced range of motion of their upper extremity: able to lift their arm and hand to an intermediate level between unlimited and not above shoulder, with no pronation or supination of the hand.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person has a reduced range of motion of their upper extremity: able to lift their arm and hand to an intermediate level between unlimited and not above shoulder, with no pronation or supination of the hand.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person has unlimited range of motion for their upper extremity (180 degree elevation for hand positioning).

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person has unlimited range of motion for their upper extremity (180 degree elevation for hand positioning).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
